member.summary: Wrapper for MoveToContent operation. Checks whether the current node is a content (non-white space text, CDATA, Element, EndElement, EntityReference, or EndEntity) node. If the node is not a content node, the reader skips ahead to the next content node or end of file. In both cases, the kind of collection type causes different set/add methods.

member.name: M:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.QXmlWriter.WriteDocType(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Wrapper for WriteDocType operation. It writes the DOCTYPE declaration with the specified name and optional attributes.
member.param: The name of the DOCTYPE. This must be non-empty.
If non-null it also writes PUBLIC "pubid" "sysid" where pubid and sysid are replaced with the value of the given arguments.
If pubid is null and sysid is non-null it writes SYSTEM "sysid" where sysid is replaced with the value of this argument.
If non-null it writes [subset] where subset is replaced with the value of this argument.

member.name: T:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions
member.summary: Class containing serialization options as separate boolean values.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.EmitNamespaces
member.summary: Whether tag namespaces should be written.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.AutoSetPrefixes
member.summary: Whether tag namespace prefixes should be defined in the root start Xml element and used in document content. If this option is false and is true, then namespaces are written as full strings in "xmlns=" attributes in the whole document.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.EmitDefaultNamespacePrefix
member.summary: Whether auto-set prefix for default namespace should be written.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.RemoveUnusedNamespaces
member.summary: Whether unused tag namespaces should be removed on serialization.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.IgnoreMissingConstructor
member.summary: Types to be deserialized must have parameterless constructor. Whether a type found during scanning available types hase no public parameterless constructor, the exception is thrown unless this option is set.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.AcceptAllProperties
member.summary: Whether properties not marked with any XmlAttribute/XmlElement attributes are to be serialized.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.AcceptDataMembers
member.summary: Whether only properties marked with DataMember attribute are to be serialized. XmlAttribute/XmlElement attributes are also recognized.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.AcceptFields
member.summary: Whether fields are to be serialized along with properties.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.SimplePropertiesAsAttributes
member.summary: Whether simple type properties not marked with any XmlAttribute are to be serialized as attributes.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.UniqueMemberTypesAsContentElements
member.summary: Whether members with unique types that are serialized as element are to be serialized as contentElements (without element tag).

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.AttributeNameCase
member.summary: Whether XML attribute names should change case on serialization.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.ElementNameCase
member.summary: Whether XML element names should change case on serialization.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.EnumNameCase
member.summary: Whether enumeration value names should change case on serialization.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.IgnoreCaseOnEnum
member.summary: Whether enum values letter case should be ignored on deserialization. Boolean case is always ignored.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.PrecedePropertyNameWithClassName
member.summary: Whether property names serialized as Xml element should be preceded with its class name. A dot character ('.') is used as a separator (like in XAML).

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.Culture
member.summary: Culture used in numbers during serialization/deserialization. Default is invariant culture.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.AllowUnregisteredTypes
member.summary: Specifies that when the serializer finds an unregistered type, it tries to serialize it anyhow.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.IgnoreUnknownElements
member.summary: Specifies that when the deserializer finds an unknown XML element, it skips to the closing element (or ignores if it is an empty element).

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.UseNilValue
member.summary: Writes xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" in the first element. Writes xsi:nil="true" attribute when value is null. If this flag is false, then a null value is simply omitted.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.UseXsiType
member.summary: Writes xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" in the first element. Writes xsi:type="typeName" attribute when serializing a property with multiple derived types. If this flag is true, then a property-named Xml element is itself a class instance element where class name is written as first xsi:type attribute. If this flag is false, then property name is serialized as a compound Xml element with contains a whole class instance Xml element.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.UseXsdScheme
member.summary: Writes xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" in the first element.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.WriteListCapacity
member.summary: Specifies whether the capacity of lists should be written as an attribute during serialization.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.ThrowOnCircularReferences
member.summary: Specifies whether an exception should be thrown when a circular reference is detected during serialization.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.LineLengthLimit
member.summary: Limit divides text to separate lines when Base64Binary converter was used.

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.FalseString
member.summary: String to write as false value;

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.TrueString
member.summary: String to write as false value;

member.summary: Conversion options for default TypeConverter

member.name: P:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.SerializationOptions.DateTimeFormat

member.name: M:Qhta.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationInfoMapper.GetIdProperty(Qhta.Xml.Reflection.SerializationTypeInfo)
member.summary: Gets a property which is indented to be serialized as identifier the entity. First a property which is marked with is searched. If there is more than one such property, then properties are sorted by If no property is marked with [Key], then properties started with "Id" or as "[TypeName]Id" or named as "Name" are searched. Only the first such property is used. If others are found, an exception is thrown. When the id property is found, it is registered in serialization type info.
member.param: Serialization info for type to reflect
member.returns: A serialization property info or null if not found
member.exception: If a property pointed out with is not found.

member.summary: Registers a property which is indented to be serialized as a text content of the Xml element. This is the first property which is marked with . Note that only the first found property is used. If others are found, an exception is thrown.
member.param: Serialization info for type to reflect
member.returns: A serialization property info or null if not found
member.exception: If a property pointed out with is not found.

member.returns: A serialization property info or null if not found
member.exception: If a property pointed out with is not found.

member.summary:
Gets a type converter for a type. It can be pointed out with a
in a header of the type. This attribute holds the converter type name. To use the converter, it must be defined in the same assembly as the type and must have a parameterless public constructor.
member.param: A type fo reflect
member.exception:
Thrown in two cases:
Type converter of the specified name could not be found
Type converter can not convert to/from string type
